metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23946 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Git, a revision control system, is vulnerable to path traversal prior to versions 2.39.2, 2.38.4, 2.37.6, 2.36.5, 2.35.7, 2.34.7, 2.33.7, 2.32.6, 2.31.7, and 2.30.8. By feeding a crafted input to `git apply`, a path outside the working tree can be overwritten as the user who is running `git apply`. A fix has been prepared and will appear in v2.39.2, v2.38.4, v2.37.6, v2.36.5, v2.35.7, v2.34.7, v2.33.7, v2.32.6, v2.31.7, and v2.30.8. As a workaround, use `git apply --stat` to inspect a patch before applying; avoid applying one that creates a symbolic link and then creates a file beyond the symbolic link.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-all - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-arch - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-core - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-cvs - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-daemon-run - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-el - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-email - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-gui - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-man - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-mediawiki - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
git-svn - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
gitk - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
gitweb - 1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: git package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.7.4-0ubuntu1.10+esm5').
